channel.title: Example on Gustav Jansson
channel.description: Recent content in Example on Gustav Jansson

item.title: Test markdown
item.description: Here’s a code chunk with syntax highlighting: var foo = function(x) { return(x + 5); } foo(3) $ echo $EDITOR vim $ git checkout master Switched to branch 'master' Your branch is up-to-date with 'origin/master'. $ git push Everything up-to-date $ echo 'All > done!' All done! You can write regular markdown here and Jekyll will automatically convert it to a nice webpage. I strongly encourage you to take 5 minutes to learn how to write in markdown - it’ll teach you how to transform regular text into bold/italics/headings/tables/etc.
